assignments.description:
This is where you will post your Project 1 proposals. TITLE = of posting must be topic of your tutorial i.e. "Automatic Driving with Color Vision" See Project details on the Project 1 website.

  1. Title of topic (e.g. "Computer Vision for Automatic Driving")
  2. Author (your name)
  3. 1 paragraph detailing what you are going to talk about (this requires that you have done some research /reading on the subject).
  4. table of contents - break down the subject into sub-topics (each could be a major link on your website). For example, you might have for "Computer Vision for Automatic Driving"
    1. Introduction and Problem Definition
      - what is the problem of automatic driving - a car outfitted with camera or other sensors (what) driving on regular roads is the ideal...but, may describe that other people have done more easy goals (driving on race course, or only on straight roads and short distances),etc.
    2. Sensor Possibilities
      - describe different sensors that people have used to solve this problem. e.g. color camera, greyscale camera, sonar, et
    3. Finding the Road
      -here describe (maybe choose 1 or a few) different techniques people have used to find the road...i.e. following the yellow or white line, or detected edge of road
      -give details on image processing algorithms used to accomplish this
    4. Success and Failures
      -describe (the 1 or few you are comparing) system(s) success and where / why it (they) failed
    5. The Challenges
      -I (meaning you) will give readers some sense of what the greatest challenges are (i.e. speed of response, sensor problems with missallignment, noise from enviornment, etc).
      -I will also give the results of an interview with a professor/student doing research in this field (contact one of the authors via email)
    6. The Future and Conclusions
      -I (meaning you again) will let readers know about the research labs (CMU, etc) doing research in this area and what they are currently working on (I will send and email and contact professor in charge of lab to ask about it).
  5. At least 2 sources you have read (preferrably online) on the subject and used to create the paragraph.

this IS FIRST COME FIRST SERVE....meaning if a prior (by time/date) posting has taken the topic you may NOT re-use that topic. If you select a topic covered in class material you must cover it in much more depth than presented or different aspects (be careful).

discussion_entries.message:
Proposal : Computer Vision for Crop Disease Detection in Precision Agriculture

Author: Navdeep Singh (Group 5)

Plant disease can devastate crops, reducing food security and farmer income. This project explores how modern computer vision techniques use images from smartphones, drones, and fixed cameras analyzed by deep learning to detect early signs of disease in crops. Methods using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and transfer learning will be discussed, focusing on how they identify color, texture, and shape variations. The tutorial will address challenges such as dataset diversity, real-time field deployment, and the adaptation to a wide range of crops. The discussion closes with trends in AI-powered farming and future research directions in sustainable agriculture.

Table of contents:

  1. Introduction and Motivation (loss reduction in agriculture)

  2. Sensor Modalities (smartphones, drones, hyperspectral cameras)

  3. Classical and Deep Learning Approaches (preprocessing, transfer learning, CNNs)

  4. Successes & Failures (field studies, generalization, cloud-based prediction)

  5. Challenges (dataset bias, weather, scalability)

  6. The Future & Conclusions (smart farms, policy, research labs)

Sources:

  • Plant Disease Detection Using Computer Vision - imagevision.ai

  • Computer Vision For Plant Disease Detection - meegle.com

assignments.description:
SUBMIT YOURS FOR PEER-EVALUATION: This is where you will turn in Project 1 final tutorial.....As you will be looking at others tutorials, it needs to be completely accessible here via a link you provide to your tutorial.

REVIEW OTHERS REVIEW -You will use the published rubric associated with this to review each person assigned to you.   YOU MUST give comments for each item in the rubric.
assignments.name: Project 1 - Final Tutorial

rubric.long_description: The tutorial should be organized. It SHOULD not look like a long paper simply poped-up on the web. You should have a nice intro page with an easy navigation scheme present throughout the site's pages.  Have multiple pages in the website

ratings.long_description: Well organized with clear headings and style.
Overall Good but some small inconsistencies with layout
Organization into pages is confusing (to a limited degree)
Organization is poor and difficult for user to understand content based on organization.

rubric.long_description:
Web tutorial. That means HTML/CSS with supporting media. Navigation should be easy.
Look and Feel appropriate and engaging.
It should also not take too long to load pages.
You should post your on-line tutorial to your github account using github pages.

ratings.long_description: Deployed as approprite to GitHub pages. Navigation works well with no broken links.
Overall Good but some inconsistency or issues with navigation
Some issues with navigation, issues with layout inconsistency.
Did not deploy on github pages, navigation issues, etc.

rubric.long_description: Detail -overall  give summary of concepts, results given--how well works.

ratings.long_description: Good summary of concepts, results are given, etc.
Overall Good but some grammar errors
Difficult to understand what the topic of research being covered is about.
Major issues with understandability of summary of problem.

rubric.long_description: If you are discussing a topic that involves the development of software or algorithms, you should present a minimum of one algorithm or piece of code on the topic. You should discuss how the algorithm works and if there are alternatives compare them to others, summarizing with what you think (and others may think) are superior algorithms (and why). Also, give the user an idea when you might apply one technique over another.  If you are discussing a topic that is hardware-based, you should discuss the various hardware options, the components of the hardware system(s), how the hardware works, the conditions under which the hardware system(s) should be used, the output format of the hardware.

ratings.long_description: Details are given so that the alogrihtm and/or hardware system can be fully understood in its operation.  Comparisions to previous or other work should be given.   Explanation of operating conditions and assumptions should is adequately explained.
Overall Good but some grammar errors
Difficult to understand some of what is being explained in algorithms/hardware.   Comparisions to pervious/other work lacking
Major issues with understandability of system.  Missing comparison to other work.

rubric.description: Detail- applications discussed + results of research
rubric.long_description: Discuss application(s) of the research  in detail, present results.  Compare other research

ratings.long_description:
Application(s) of the research is fully detailed. 
Discuss and present researh results.  Contrast and compare different  research that may accomplish the same or similar (or different if appropriate) goals.
Overall Good but some grammar errors
Difficult to understand some of what is being explained in algorithms/hardware.   Comparisions to pervious/other work lacking
Major issues with understandability of system.  Missing comparison to other work.

rubric.long_description: Discuss the limitations of the system.  If multiple research system reviewed compare limiations

ratings.long_description: Detailed discussion of limitations of research presented is given and illustrations of how this will effect its practical application.
Overall Good but some grammar errors
Difficult to understand some of what is being explained.   Discussion of impact to applicaiton of system being used is missing/lacking
Major issues with understandability.
No grammar errors
Only a few grammatical issues
More than a few grammatical errors

rubric.long_description: Someone should be able to complete the tutorial within 30 minutes, and it should minimally take 15 minutes unassisted.

ratings.long_description: wintin -5 minutes of required ammounts
In specified range: Someone should be able to complete the tutorial within 30 minutes, and it should minimally take 15 minutes unassisted.
Too short more than 5 minutes less than specified.
nothing turned in

rubric.long_description: Your writing should be original. You can NOT paraphrase large blocks of text. If you need to paraphrase smaller items, you need to refer to the article in which the text comes from and surround the text with quotes. You should keep to a bare minimum the number of times you paraphrase others words.

You are to incorporate some kind of interactive activity - either a test/ quiz (you don't have to grade it) or some kind of special video of a demonstration (you create) or a slide show (you create) ,etc. If there is an existing implementation you can use that in a demo.

ratings.long_description: Present and adequate
activity's level of appropriateness and complexity (too simple) is not adequate

rubric.long_description: You are required to have links in your on-line (or powerpoint) tutorial to an annotated bibliography. You must have a minimum of 5 different references (please note different pages on the same web-site do NOT count). Throughout your on-line tutorial, each time you wish to quote a reference, it should be represented by a number that is hyper-text linked to the annotated bibliography. In this bibliography page, you will have listed in order of appearance (hence the numbers) your references each followed by an annotation of the contents of the reference. Specifically, you must include not only the title, author, date, source, but also, a sysnopsis, and a reliability rating. For example, for the second reference you would have:

ratings.long_description: Have number of required references, they are cited and properly formated
Lacking in #, format, citation

rubric.long_description: You must have a minimum of 5 pictures or diagrams illustrating the concept you are discussing. As appropriate include video or audio also. If you borrow images, you must reference in the legend where you retrieved them from. You must add voice to each of your individual web pages

ratings.long_description:
Required minimum of 5 appropriate pictures/digrams that help with understanding concepts.   Each has a caption which not only say what it is but, gives a reference to where you obtained the media. 

Also add voice to each of your individual webpages

Lacking in number (minimum 5) of media, citations, legends.

Lacking voice on each webpage.

rubric.long_description:
YouTube video that is a presentation using BOTH this powerpoint AND your github pages Tutorial.
Your voice should be hear clearly as well as any text in the YouTube video should be easily readable. Audio IS REQUIRED.

ratings.long_description: Good job, clear understanding of tutorial and all details covered.
Everything understandable but possibly a few issues with clarity.
More than a few points where audio not clear, video not clear or discussion of information is lacking.
Not given
